channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to prohibit gender election on passports
item.description: The court's decision is not a final ruling, however; it just permits Trump's passport policy to go into effect while litigation continues in the lower courts.
item.content:encoded:
The court's decision is not a final ruling, however; it just permits Trump's passport policy to go into effect while litigation continues in the lower courts.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: After California's vote to counter Trump, here's where redistricting stands
item.description: In the summer, Texas drew new lines to help the GOP win in the midterm elections. California countered this week. The Republicans might have an edge in the redistricting battle as it spreads nationally.
item.content:encoded: In the summer, Texas drew new lines to help the GOP win in the midterm elections. California countered this week. The Republicans might have an edge in the redistricting battle as it spreads nationally.
item.dc:creator: Larry Kaplow

item.title: Subway sandwich thrower found not guilty in D.C. jury rebuke
item.description: The acquittal on a misdemeanor charge comes after the case came to represent broader resistance in the nation's capital to the Trump administration's law enforcement surge.
item.content:encoded:
The acquittal on a misdemeanor charge comes after the case came to represent broader resistance in the nation's capital to the Trump administration's law enforcement surge.

(Image credit: Andrew Leyden)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: White House strikes deals for lower prices on obesity drugs
item.description: Medicare beneficiaries will soon be able to get obesity and Type 2 diabetes drugs for a $50 copay. But there are some limitations.
item.content:encoded:
Medicare beneficiaries will soon be able to get obesity and Type 2 diabetes drugs for a $50 copay. But there are some limitations.

(Image credit: Dhiraj Singh)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: 50 years ago, the Edmund Fitzgerald, a 'rock star' ship, sank in Lake Superior
item.description: Twenty-nine sailors drowned when the Edmund Fitzgerald went down in the Great Lakes' icy waters on Nov. 10, 1975. The ship was immortalized in a surprise hit 1976 folk ballad by Gordon Lightfoot.
item.content:encoded:
Twenty-nine sailors drowned when the Edmund Fitzgerald went down in the Great Lakes' icy waters on Nov. 10, 1975. The ship was immortalized in a surprise hit 1976 folk ballad by Gordon Lightfoot.

(Image credit: Bettmann Archive)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: A former teacher shot by her 6-year-old student wins a $10 million jury verdict
item.description: Abby Zwerner's lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings that a child had a gun at the Newport News, Va., school that day. A bullet damaged her left hand and remains in her chest.
item.content:encoded:
Abby Zwerner's lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings that a child had a gun at the Newport News, Va., school that day. A bullet damaged her left hand and remains in her chest.

(Image credit: Stephen M. Katz)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A reporter outlines Trump's options to subvert the 2026 midterm elections
item.description: The Atlantic journalist David A. Graham describes how Trump could potentially use troops near polling places, pressure local election workers and have federal agents seize voting machines.
item.content:encoded: The Atlantic journalist David A. Graham describes how Trump could potentially use troops near polling places, pressure local election workers and have federal agents seize voting machines.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Tesla shareholders approve Elon Musk's trillion-dollar pay package
item.description: Tesla shareholders have approved a pay package for Elon Musk that could allow him to earn an unprecedented one trillion dollars' worth of stock.
item.content:encoded:
Tesla shareholders have approved a pay package for Elon Musk that could allow him to earn an unprecedented one trillion dollars' worth of stock.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Wall Street reckons with life under Zohran Mamdani
item.description: New York City's CEOs and other billionaires spent more than $40 million trying to defeat the mayor-elect. Now they have to live with him.
item.content:encoded:
New York City's CEOs and other billionaires spent more than $40 million trying to defeat the mayor-elect. Now they have to live with him.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Former Speaker Nancy Pelosi will not seek reelection
item.description: A shrewd political strategist, California Rep. Nancy Pelosi has had an unprecedented career in Congress. First elected in 1987, Pelosi became one of the most effective leaders of the Democratic Party.
item.content:encoded:
A shrewd political strategist, California Rep. Nancy Pelosi has had an unprecedented career in Congress. First elected in 1987, Pelosi became one of the most effective leaders of the Democratic Party.

(Image credit: Leigh Vogel)
item.dc:creator: Susan Davis
